chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua E Wille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim unless as permitted by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua E Wille

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend to Misd. Joy Riding-943.23(3m), Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered to amended charge.  Court finds def guilty on amended charge.

Def in person & by Atty John P. Kuczmarski.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety; No contact wtih JR or his residence
Preliminary hearing on September 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant will not be retaining counsel.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.  (SPD slip provided)  PRELIM TIMING NOT WAIVED.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
